block.p: Kathleen Anne Walsh and John William von Rosenberg were married yesterday evening at the Hay-Adams, the hotel in Washington. The Rev. Anne Troy, a Presbyterian minister, officiated.

The bride, 37, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a lawyer. Until last month she worked on the rights of the disabled at the Equal Rights Center, a nonprofit civil rights organization in Washington. She graduated from Brown and received her law degree cum laude from Harvard.
Kathleen Anne Walsh and John William von Rosenberg were married yesterday evening at the Hay-Adams, the hotel in Washington. The Rev. Anne Troy, a Presbyterian minister, officiated.
Kathleen Anne Walsh and John William von Rosenberg were married yesterday evening at the Hay-Adams, the hotel in Washington. The Rev. Anne Troy, a Presbyterian minister, officiated.

The bride, 37, will continue to use her name professionally. She is a lawyer. Until last month she worked on the rights of the disabled at the Equal Rights Center, a nonprofit civil rights organization in Washington. She graduated from Brown and received her law degree cum laude from Harvard.

She is the daughter of Anne C. and Ronald E. Walsh of Fairfield, Conn. Her father, who is retired, worked in Voorhees, N.J., as a vice president and the general counsel at Thames Water Americas, a former subsidiary of Thames Water, the British utility company. Her mother retired as a third-grade teacher at McKinley Elementary School in Fairfield.

The bridegroom, 39, is a bathymetrist in Bethesda, Md., compiling data on ocean depth for the National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency, which is part of the Defense Department. He graduated from Louisiana State University.
He is a son of Caroline and Charles von Rosenberg of Rock Hill, S.C. His father retired as a minister at Covington Presbyterian Church in Covington, La.
